captions.text:
- YOU LOOK--
- HI.

- YOU LOOK BEAUTIFUL.
- THANK YOU.
- YEAH, I LOVE THE NECKLACE TOO.

- THANK YOU SO MUCH.
- I LOVE THAT.

- THIS IS MY THIRD TIME
BEING HERE.
THIS IS SO EXCITING.
[cheers and applause]
- WE LOVE HAVING YOU HERE,
AND HOW ARE YOU?

- I'M DOING WELL.
I'M DOING WELL, YEAH.
THANK YOU.
IT'S CERTAINLY BEEN, YOU KNOW,
A PRETTY ROUGH YEAR,

BUT I'VE BEEN SURROUNDED
BY SUCH GREAT PEOPLE,
SUCH GREAT FAMILY.

HI, MOM.
HI, DAD.

THEY'RE SO SAD
THAT THEY CAN'T BE HERE.

THEY JUST BOUGHT A HOUSE
IN L.A., SO...

- WELL, THERE'S EXCUSE.
WHERE ARE THEY?
IT'S NOT LIKE--
- THEY'RE COMING HERE SOON,

BUT THEY WISH
THAT THEY COULD BE HERE.
- WELL, NEXT TIME YOU COME BACK,
BRING 'EM HERE.
- DEFINITELY.
MY MOM SAID SHE WAS SO UPSET
THAT SHE COULDN'T BE HERE.

- WHAT'S HER NAME?
- EDITH.

- EDITH, COME ON.
WHERE ARE YOU?
- YEAH.
- AND I UNDERSTAND--

IT WAS CRAZY, BECAUSE, YOU KNOW,
THERE WERE RUMORS

THAT WHEN KATE HUDSON
DID "GLEE,"
THAT PEOPLE DIDN'T GET ALONG,

AND THEN WHEN YOU WERE GOING
THROUGH SUCH A DIFFICULT TIME,

YOU ACTUALLY KIND OF HID OUT
AT HER HOUSE, RIGHT?

- YEAH, ALL THOSE RUMORS
WERE SO WEIRD,

AND WE EVEN WERE CALLING
EACH OTHER,

BEING LIKE,
"THIS IS SO CRAZY."

IT'S SO UNBELIEVABLE
WHAT PEOPLE CAN MAKE UP.

YOU KNOW, ALL THE--90%
OF THE STUFF THAT YOU READ,

IT'S JUST COMPLETELY FABRICATED,
MOST OF IT.
AND SHE WAS SO WONDERFUL
TO BASICALLY GIVE ME HER HOME
TO MYSELF AND MY FAMILY.
IT WAS SO HELPFUL

TO JUST BASICALLY HAVE
A SAFE PLACE

TO PROCESS AND JUST HAVE
A MINUTE TO, YOU KNOW, BREATHE
BEFORE GETTING BACK TO MY HOUSE,

WHICH HAS A LOT OF MEMORIES
AND STUFF,

SO BEING SOMEPLACE ELSE TO JUST
HAVE A MOMENT WAS REALLY...

- I CAN'T IMAGINE THAT--
YOU'RE GOING THROUGH THE LOSS,

YOU'RE GOING THROUGH FEELINGS
AND ALL THIS,

AND THEN YOU TRY TO GO OUT
OF YOUR HOUSE,

AND THERE'S PAPARAZZI OR PEOPLE
JUST HANGING OUT.
YOU CAN'T EVEN, LIKE--

THEY DON'T GIVE YOU THE DECENCY,
THE RESPECT,

TO GRIEVE
AND DO WHAT YOU NEED TO DO
THAT YOU GO HIDE SOMEWHERE.
- IT'S PRETTY INTENSE.

AND THEN IF YOU SMILE,
IT'S LIKE,
"SHE'S SO HAPPY,"
AND THEN IF YOU'RE, YOU KNOW,
IF YOU LOOK SAID, THEY'RE LIKE,
"SHE'S TERRIBLE."

AND IT'S LIKE, YOU KNOW,
IT'S JUST REALLY HARD.

THERE'S SO MANY
DIFFERENT EMOTIONS,

AND TO KIND OF HAVE PEOPLE
WATCHING EVERY STEP OF THE WAY,

BUT TO HAVE THAT TIME
AT HER HOME

TO JUST REALLY, YOU KNOW,
BE IN PRIVATE WITH THIS
FOR A MOMENT,
BEFORE GETTING BACK TO WORK
AND BEFORE GOING HOME WAS--
I'M SO THANKFUL TO HER.
- YEAH.
AND THEN YOU HAD TO--

YOU ACTUALLY HAD TO GO BACK
TO WORK ON "GLEE"
SHORTLY AFTER CORY'S PASSING,

AND WAS THAT GOOD BECAUSE
YOU WERE AROUND PEOPLE

THAT WERE EXPERIENCING
SIMILAR THINGS,
OR WAS IT HARDER OR...

- YEAH, WELL, RYAN MURPHY,
WHO'S SO AMAZING,

YOU KNOW, HE CAME
TO KATE'S HOUSE,

AND HE SAID, YOU KNOW,
"WHAT DO YOU WANT TO DO?

WHATEVER YOU WANT TO DO,
WE'LL DO."

I SAID, "I HAVE TO GO BACK
TO WORK.
"YOU KNOW, WE HAVE TO.
THIS IS OUR--THEY'RE MY FAMILY."

AND, YOU KNOW, WHAT PEOPLE ALSO
DON'T UNDERSTAND

IS THAT GOING TO WORK
IS NO HARDER
THAN BEING AT HOME
AND BEING IN THE HOUSE

AND OPENING UP A CLOSET
AND SEEING A PAIR OF SHOES.
IT'S LIKE, THERE'S--

GRIEF GOES WITH YOU
EVERY DAY,
WHATEVER YOU'RE DOING,
WHEN THERE'S GREAT MOMENTS,
WHEN THERE'S HARD MOMENTS,
SO I'D RATHER, FOR ME,

BE AT WORK WITH THE PEOPLE
THAT I LOVE,

THAT ARE GOING THROUGH
THE SAME THING,

AND IT OBVIOUSLY HAS ITS OWN
TRIGGERS, YOU KNOW,
BUT AT THE END OF THE DAY,
I FEEL SO SAFE THERE,

AND LIKE I SAID,
THEY'RE MY FAMILY.
- AND WAS THE TRIBUTE,
WAS IT--
IT MUST HAVE BEEN CATHARTIC.

THERE WAS, YOU KNOW, KIND OF
CLOSURE OR WHATEVER
TO ADDRESS IT,

BUT, I MEAN, HOW YOU GOT
THROUGH IT,
AND EVEN THE TEEN CHOICE AWARDS,

I JUST YOU JUST HAVE BEEN
SO STRONG,

BECAUSE ANYONE WHO'S LOST
SOMEONE CLOSE TO THEM
KNOWS WHAT THAT FEELS LIKE,

BUT TO DEAL WITH IT PUBLICLY
AND TO HAVE TO JUST--

LIKE YOU SAID, THERE'S GOOD DAYS
AND BAD DAYS.

I THINK YOU'VE BEEN AMAZING.
- THANK YOU.

- I THINK YOU'VE BEEN
REALLY, REALLY GREAT.

- I REALLY FEEL LIKE I'M STILL
TRYING TO FIGURE OUT
ALL OF THIS.
IT'S BEEN ONLY A FEW MONTHS.

BUT MY MOM HAS EXPERIENCED
A LOT OF LOSS IN HER LIFE,

AND SHE TOLD ME AT ONE POINT,
SHE SAID,

"THERE IS AN EMPOWERMENT
THAT COMES WITH GRIEF.

"AT SOME POINT YOU FIND IT,
AND IT'S VERY HARD,
BUT YOU WILL FIND IT."

AND I THINK THAT AT
A CERTAIN POINT

YOU CAN CHOOSE TO SORT OF FALL
FROM THIS
OR YOU CAN CHOOSE TO RISE,

AND THAT'S WHAT I'M JUST TRYING
TO DO MY BEST--

FOR HIM, BECAUSE THAT THAT'S
WHAT HE WOULD HAVE WANTED,
AND TO JUST DO MY BEST
AND TO, YOU KNOW, HOPEFULLY,

MAKE SOMETHING,
YOU KNOW, POSITIVE

FOR WHERE I GO
IN THE REST OF MY LIFE.
- SOMEONE TOLD ME SOMETHING ONCE
THAT HAS STUCK WITH ME.
WHEN YOUR HEART IS BROKEN,

WHEN YOU HAVE CRACKS
IN YOUR HEART,
IT LETS THE LIGHT IN.
IT LETS THE SUN IN.

AND I JUST--I HOLD ON TO THAT
ALL THE TIME,
BECAUSE YOU HAVE TO.
YOU HAVE TO KNOW THAT.
WHEN CORY WAS HERE,

HE WAS--HE ADMITTED HERE
ON THE SHOW,
BECAUSE Y'ALL WERE SO ELUSIVE

ABOUT ADMITTING YOU WERE
A COUPLE,
AND WHEN HE WAS HERE,
HE WAS SO ADORABLE,

YOU KNOW, TALKING ABOUT
AND ADMITTING--
- I KNOW.

IT'S ONE OF MY
FAVORITE MEMORIES.

I REMEMBER WHEN HE CAME HOME
THAT NIGHT,

AND HE SORT OF PUFFED OUT
HIS CHEST AND HE WAS LIKE,

"I TALKED ABOUT YOU ON 'ELLEN'
TODAY."
AND I WAS SO HAPPY.
HE WAS SUCH A PRIVATE PERSON,

AND I LITERALLY LIVED EVERY DAY
OF MY LIFE

FEELING LIKE THE LUCKIEST GIRL
IN THE WHOLE WORLD.

I JUST THOUGHT
HE WAS THE GREATEST MAN.

AND SO, YOU KNOW,
AT THAT MOMENT, THAT MEMORY,

IT'S JUST--
IT MEANS SO MUCH TO ME.
- YEAH, HE WAS A GREAT GUY.
AND YOU ARE A GREAT LADY.
- THANK YOU.
- WE WILL TAKE A BREAK,

AND WE'LL BE BACK WITH
LEA MICHELE.

comments.author: Joyce Williams

comments.text:
I have something to say to all of the people leaving heartless comments.

Please either keep your "facts" to yourself, or just grow up. Every vile 
word you post is irrevocable, and you can't take it back even if you delete 
your comment(s). Lea loved Cory, and he loved her. She's not a "diva," nor 
is she "milking his death for fame." You are either COMPLETELY oblivious on 
what it feels like to lose someone you love, or you are just a poor, 
disappointing, egotistic person who just wants to leave hateful comments 
because you are SO desperate. You feel the need to be heartless, so that in 
your mind, you can think "People are replying to my comments! I feel loved! 
Oh my god, I'm so happy I decided to be a self-centered, vile, awful person 
who feels the need to make everything worse for everyone else who actually 
has a heart!" Whose the one practically begging for fame now?﻿
comments.author: WizardLockhart1012

comments.text:
I know from personal experience that having anyone that you love in you're 
life ,whether its your parents or a spouse , that does drugs is an 
extremely scary thing. That's why at 17, I know for a fact that I will 
never do drugs or date anyone who does drugs. People that do drugs are not 
bad people, the ones I have encountered are the ones that love me the most. 
However, it is a painful experience, and that's why I would never date 
anyone who does drugs. Ever.﻿
comments.author: Kali Turner

﻿

comments.text:
this woman is awful, she's just like reopening the pain Lea was trying to 
settle down in order to make a good show and satisfy the audience. It's 
totally obvious Lea is uncomfortable about it, just look at how she bits 
her lips, the expressions she puts, she fact that she doesn't say Cory's 
name not even once or her constant movement of hands. ¿Why does these 
people have to mess with other people's life? This poor girls was having a 
hard moment and everyone just kept on remembering her what happened and 
asking her "Did it hurt?" like idiots, of course it must have been painful. 
I'm really disapointed at how selfish can some poeple be. ﻿
comments.author: Brigide

comments.text:
Yeah, dude? This was most likely planned. Notice the emphasis on the 
paparazzi messing with her? Ellen is trying to help Lea clear some things 
up, in a subtle, business like fashion. Also, the paparazzi who have been 
stalking her, see THE Ellen DeGeneres looking down upon what they are doing 
and the harassment would wane a bit. Again, people plan their interviews. 
Lea is a strong-willed person.
comments.author: Jasmine Nappier

comments.text:
+RoOxymoon I hope you understand that this interview was not a surprise and 
the topics are agreed in advance. Ellen does not ambush people in mourning. 
Lea came on the show on purpose, to let her fans know that she was healing 
and (more importantly) to publicize her solo album, which they discussed 
next. PS: People who want to be left alone don't schedule interviews on 
national TV.
comments.author: sparklemotion101

comments.text:
people who go on the show are asked weeks or days before hand the interview 
on what they will talk about. lea knew.
comments.author: Abigail B

comments.text:
Will before the show Ellen likes to talk to whoever she's interviewing and 
make sure that they're comfortable with what she wants to talk about it. So 
I'm sure lea already knew what was coming

comments.text:
There are so many trolls on who comment on videos on youtube. It literally 
disgusts me. Some are so adept at their craft that even I am left 
considering whether they are ignorant, stupid, or in fact trolling.

In any case, I would advise against putting fuel on the fires these 
people start. I thought this interview was quite appropriate, and I would 
suggest people not to get drawn into conversation threads that are 
irrelevant or inappropriate.  ﻿

it's a bit like Ellen tried to make her cry, mostly with that picture at

comments.author: ElleRoueDeCharrue

comments.text:
Also, bless Kate Hudson for being so caring to open up her home to Lea and 
her family and allow them to have that crucial time they needed to grieve 
before she had to head back out into the media spotlight.﻿
comments.author: Brianna Huber

comments.text:
Seeing people comment on here about how Lea shouldn't give an interview 
about something so personal, and saying Ellen was trying to make Lea cry 
for publicity of the video, just proves Lea's point about how hard it is to 
go through something like this in the public eye. No matter what, there 
will always be someone who criticizes. I think Ellen seemed very sensitive 
and caring, and Lea knows Cory's and her fans loved him, too, so I think 
she feels safe to share her grief with us. I hope she's ok.﻿
comments.author: Brianna Huber

comments.text: She pretty and kind and has a big heart she will be happy she deserves it﻿

i admire the way she stays strong after what happened .. hope she is better

comments.text:
I remember when my step-sister called me with the news that he died, and I 
was just like, 
'No, no, you have the wrong guy. Not Cory. Nope.' 
And she just said, 'Ok, whatever.'

And then she hung up and I just dropped the phone and sat in shock. 
Terrible Day.﻿

comments.text:
It's a shame that he passed. His addiction got the best of him. Not trying 
to be disrespectful but I'm going to say it anyway. This is a reason that 
you don't do drugs. Don't try them,don't even think about trying them. They 
make your life shit. And this is coming from a 13 year old who NEVER will 
try drugs or any crap like that. Be careful of who you surround yourself 
with because they will pressure who if they are not good friends.﻿
comments.author: Julianne Wall

comments.text: You are the example of how 13 year olds should act.
comments.author: Jennifer P

comments.text:

comments.author: Fernando Herrera

comments.text: Bless you, very wise for a 13 year old :)!
comments.author: Yeah no

comments.text:
Holy...you sound so mature for a 13 year old! I really, sincerely hope peer 
pressure doesn't get to you. It's better not to experience being drunk or 
high at all, just so not worth it.
comments.author: rt1290

comments.text:
+sparklemotion101 Well I totally approve of drinking if it's just to drink. 
Like ordering a drink on the plane or at a restaurant, because you're not 
doing it to get wild, you're just enjoying the beverage. That I can handle. 
But as a college student I just don't look forward to the weekends where I 
open my Snapchat to a ton of snaps/stories of my friends at raging parties 
drinking with the sole intent to just get drunk and wild, which is why I 
just don't have any interest in alcohol at all, the social abuse of it at 
our age turns me off entirely.
comments.author: m13laball

comments.text:
+m13laball It's possible to drink without getting drunk, but drugs 
(especially certain highly addictive drugs) are trickier and it is better 
to skip them. But unless you have a religious or medical reason for not 
drinking, if you're in college why not have a drink and find out what it's 
like? Wait until you're 21 if that makes you more comfortable, but after 
school is finished you'll find that it's unusual for adults to not drink at 
all (if you're not mormon/muslim/pentecostal etc or ill, people will assume 
you have a drinking problem and are in recovery if you refuse all alcohol). 
Drinking in moderation is good for your heart, and you might find that you 
enjoy the taste of wine, beer, and cocktails.
comments.author: sparklemotion101

comments.text:
I'm actually glad you said this! So many people are commenting things like 
"He's worthless he was a drug addict." But look at the drug addicts you see 
on TV, the news, cop shows, etc. Cory wasn't like them at all. He was a 
good guy who unfortunately succumbed to something horrible at a very young 
age. Like you said, you need to surround yourself with good people. This is 
why I hate society. I'm 19, I'm in college, I feel like I don't fit in 
anywhere because everyone is out drinking and getting high, even some of 
the nicest, most mature and responsible people I know. I don't get why 
society needs to be so infatuated with this lifestyle. There's nothing cool 
about it.
comments.author: m13laball

I think Glee helped prolong Cory's life. Without it we probably would've 
lost him sooner than we did. It definitely brought out the best in him. He 
was a beautiful soul who had a very serious problem but like Lea said, "he 
was not his addiction." RIP Cory.﻿
